speaker: Agent (Personal)
utterance:
Congrats on the new car — happy to help get it insured. A few quick details and preferences from you and I’ll prepare personalised quotes (I can send them via WhatsApp or email):

What I need
- Car make, model & variant (e.g., Maruti Swift VXi)
- Manufacture year
- Registration number (or chassis/engine number)
- Registration date and city of registration
- Is the car registered in your name? (Yes/No)

Cover & preferences
- Do you want comprehensive cover (recommended) or third‑party only?
- Preferred deductible/excess — you mentioned “low” (e.g., ₹1,000–₹5,000). Which exact amount would you like?
- Do you have any No Claim Bonus (NCB)? If yes, what % and do you have the previous policy document?

Add‑ons (pick any you want included)
- Zero depreciation (engineered for new/expensive parts)
- Roadside assistance / breakdown support
- Consumables cover (oil, nuts/bolts after claim)
- Tire protection
- Engine protection / hydrostatic lock
- Return to invoice

Other useful info
- Will the car be used personally or for commercial/ride‑sharing?
- Any anti‑theft device fitted?
- Preferred contact to receive quotes: WhatsApp number or email?

About the insurer I’ll quote from
I can provide quotes from Digit Insurance — they do fully online policies, paperless issuance, smartphone-based claim inspections, and useful add‑ons like tire protection, consumables cover and roadside support.

Next step
Share the details above and your preferred contact method. I’ll prepare 2–3 tailored options (different IDVs/deductibles/add‑ons) and send them over so you can pick and buy online right away.

utterance: Can you help me insure my new vehicle? [Vehicle Description: ]

utterance: Sure — could you share the vehicle make, model, year, registration city and fuel type, plus engine CC/odometer and whether you want comprehensive or third‑party cover? speaker: Agent (Credibility)
utterance:
Great — I can get you quick WhatsApp quotes. To prepare accurate options (including Liberty General’s budget-friendly comprehensive cover), please send the following details:

1. Vehicle make & model (e.g., Maruti Swift VXi)  
2. Year of manufacture  
3. Registration city / RTO  
4. Fuel type (Petrol / Diesel / CNG / EV)  
5. Engine CC and current odometer (km)  
6. Cover wanted: Comprehensive or Third‑Party  
7. Willing to take a moderate voluntary excess? (Yes / No) — moderate typically means around ₹2,000–₹5,000 and usually lowers the premium.  
8. Add‑ons required: Zero‑depreciation, Roadside assistance, Engine protection (tick which ones you want)  
9. Is the vehicle new (never insured) or previously insured? If previously, share current insurer, policy expiry date and NCB % (if known) and any claim history in last 3 years.  
10. WhatsApp number to send quotes (please include +91) and best time to message.

Once you send these, I’ll prepare 2–3 quote options and WhatsApp them to you within about 20–30 minutes. If you prefer email or SMS instead, tell me and I’ll use that.

speaker: Agent (Personal)
utterance:
I completely understand — let’s see what I can do to get this within your budget.

I can try two approaches: reduce the premium by about ₹1,500–2,000 (subject to underwriting) or add a loyalty perk (common options: free 1‑yr add‑on like Roadside Assistance / Key Replacement / Zero Dep* or waive policy/processing fees). Zero‑dep is usually possible only for newer cars (vehicle age limits apply), while roadside/key assist are easier to add.

Please share these details so I can run a quick revised quote and message it to you on WhatsApp:
- Current quoted premium (₹)
- Vehicle make, model & year
- Registration city
- Which loyalty perk do you prefer — free 1‑yr add‑on (tell me which: Roadside Assistance, Key Replacement, Zero Dep) OR waived fees?
- Policy start date
- Best WhatsApp number to send the revised quote

Also tell me if any add‑ons are already included in the quote. I’ll review and get back with the best possible option.
